intro: Anisachne gracilis var. multinodis, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and along stream banks. Its leaves are linear and often have a slight sheen, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. Anisachne gracilis var. multinodis plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and provides habitat for various insect species.
